intro: Valeriana gallinae, commonly known as the chicken valerian, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, often reddish or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands, meadows, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its roots are fibrous and contain essential oils. Valeriana gallinae is known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used for its calming and sedative effects.
